metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4283 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in X.Org. This security flaw occurs because the XkbCopyNames function left a dangling pointer to freed memory, resulting in out-of-bounds memory access on subsequent XkbGetKbdByName requests.. This issue can lead to local privileges elevation on systems where the X server is running privileged and remote code execution for ssh X forwarding sessions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xdmx-tools - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xnest - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xorg-server-source - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xserver-common - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xvfb - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
